connector.description:
Receive events from Azure Event Hubs.

There are two different mechanism of authentication `CONNECTION_STRING` and `AZURE_IDENTITY`, you could specify with credentialType property. If you're using `CONNECTION_STRING` sharedAccessName and sharedAccessKey properties will be needed.

In case of `AZURE_IDENTITY` selection, the DefaultAzureCredential will attempt to authenticate via the following mechanisms in the following order enviroment, Workload Identity, Managed Identity, Azure Developer CLI, IntelliJ, Azure CLI and Azure Powershell.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sha.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sharedAccessName
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sha.description: The Event Hubs SAS key name.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sha.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sharedAccessKey
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.sha.description: The key for the Event Hubs SAS key name.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blobAccountName
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.description: The name of the Storage Blob account.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blobContainerName
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.description: The name of the Storage Blob container.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blobAccessKey
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.blo.description: The key for the Azure Storage Blob service that is associated with the Storage Blob account name.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.cre.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.credentialType
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-source.cre.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt.
